message: Just getting into rendering maps of my servers (using Minecraft Overviewer for now) and wondering: is it safe/reasonable to be running these programs on the world folder while the server is running? Or is this asking for disaster? How are people dealing with this for always-on servers?

As long as they only read from the world folder and don't write to it, that should be perfectly safe. And I can't imagine a reason why any of them would write there. Of course you should still automate backups as there's both griefers and bugs :)
Alright, thanks! That was my assumption, just wanted to sanity check it. :)
I've always run Overviewer on the active save file. Make sure to set it up using the biome data as it looks so much better.

Personally, I use PigMap but the process might be useful for anyone doing automated mapping.

Before I rendered the first map I took a complete copy of the world, saved to the /map folder and ran Pigmap on that data

Then, every 4 hours, I do an rsync which takes only the differences between the server and the last copy. This minimises reads from the live server and, obviously, minimises lag.
Pigmap allows you to add your own textures to the render... this is my current map... highlights include a massive golden buddha and a pirate ship... http://91.215.157.175/map.html
I've never used Overviewer, sounds like it's popular though.
Does Pigmap render lighting, and/or elevation? I'm not hugely impressed with Overviewer, it was just the first one I tried, and it 'worked.'
Pigmap is the best looking one I've found. Not sure about lighting though. Google will know :)
